summary: The Missile Defense Agency (MDA) is developing systems to counter hypersonic missiles. These weapons are capable of flight at speeds 5 times the speed of sound, and can maneuver mid-flight—which makes tracking them difficult. MDA's Glide Phase Interceptor is a missile designed to shoot down a hypersonic weapon in the middle (or glide phase) of its flight. However, we found that MDA doesn't have plans...
title: Missile Defense: Better Oversight and Coordination Needed for Counter-Hypersonic Development
